main.java.embl.rieslab.emu.configuration

Class ConfigurationWizard

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.embl.rieslab.emu.configuration.ConfigurationWizard

  • public class ConfigurationWizard
extends java.lang.Object
    UI used to configure the system by allocating UI properties to existing device properties in Micro-manager, the values of their state if applicable and the values of the UI parameters.
    Author:
    Joran Deschamps

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String KEY_ENTERVALUE
      Value given to unallocated UIProperty states and UIParameters values.
      static java.lang.String KEY_UIPARAMETER 
      static java.lang.String KEY_UIPROPERTY 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConfigurationWizard(ConfigurationController config) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getWizardParameters()
      Returns the entries of the parameter table as a HashMap with the keys being the UIParameter names and the values being the parameter values.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getWizardProperties()
      Returns the entries of the property table as a HashMap with the keys being the UIProperty names or state names, and the values being the allocated MMProperty names or state values.
      boolean isRunning()
      Checks if the wizard is already running by returning an internal member variable.
      void showHelp(boolean b)
      Sets the help window visible and displays the description of the currently selected UIProperty or UIParameter.
      void shutDown()
      Closes open windows (wizard frame and help)
      void start(java.lang.String pluginName, GlobalConfiguration configuration, ConfigurableFrame maininterface, MMPropertiesRegistry mmproperties)
      Starts a new configuration wizard.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConfigurationWizard

        public ConfigurationWizard(ConfigurationController config)

    • Method Detail

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Checks if the wizard is already running by returning an internal member variable.
        Returns:
        True if running, false otherwise.

      • getWizardProperties

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getWizardProperties()
        Returns the entries of the property table as a HashMap with the keys being the UIProperty names or state names, and the values being the allocated MMProperty names or state values.
        Returns:
        HashMap of the UIProperty names or state names as keys and the mapped MMProperty names or state values.

      • getWizardParameters

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getWizardParameters()
        Returns the entries of the parameter table as a HashMap with the keys being the UIParameter names and the values being the parameter values.
        Returns:
        HashMap of the UIParameter names as keys and corresponding values.

      • showHelp

        public void showHelp(boolean b)
        Sets the help window visible and displays the description of the currently selected UIProperty or UIParameter.
        Parameters:
        b - True if the help window is to be displayed, false otherwise

      • shutDown

        public void shutDown()
        Closes open windows (wizard frame and help)

      • start

        public void start(java.lang.String pluginName,
         GlobalConfiguration configuration,
         ConfigurableFrame maininterface,
         MMPropertiesRegistry mmproperties)
        Starts a new configuration wizard. If configuration is not compatible with pluginName then the wizard starts a new configuration, otherwise the wizard will allow editing configuration.
        Parameters:
        pluginName - Name of the plugin to be configured.
        configuration - Current configuration loaded in EMU.
        maininterface - ConfigurableFrame of the plugin.
        mmproperties - Device properties from Micro-Manager.
